column4: pardon, I've mounted a windows hard drive using ntfs, set the owner and chmod'ed to all read/write, yet I kee getting "permission denied" when I try to access it
anybody have a few mins to help?
ntfs is read only in linux.  read write support is extremely experimental
should I chmod them all to read only? Could that be causing an error to make it inaccessible?
I get the same here.  Do a sudo bash then try to go into your mount point, can you see the files now?
yeah, I can get in as root. Is there a special way I have to set permission for ntfs?
hang on i'll try it on mine
cool, thanks for the help man
me too.  i can mount it now as myself but no access.
ok unmount, edit /etc/fstab, add users,ro,umask=000 to the line where it said defaults.
paste me the whole line from /etc/fstab
OK. remove the defaults, add owner and change the 1's to 0's
mine looks like this /dev/hda1       /windows        ntfs    users,ro,owner,umask=000        0 0
by "add owner" do you mena just write 'owner' in the options line or something different
like mine:- /dev/hda1       /windows        ntfs    users,ro,owner,umask=000        0 0
Steep learning curve mate.  Stick with it.  I'm still new too.
how you doing there?
no need to chown
you can't change anything on this partition, just read the data.  You should be able to see the files now, as well as mount it as your user without the sudo
can't even type ls /windows, get premission denied :-P
hmm, it works for me!
no probs mate
